org.mt4j.util
Class TriangleNormalGenerator

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.util.TriangleNormalGenerator

public class TriangleNormalGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

This class can be used to generate normals for indexed triangles geometry.

  • It duplicates a vertex that has more than 1 texture coordinate. So texture with indexed geometry can still be used.
  • It also duplicates equal vertices that get assigned different normals in the calculation process according to the face they belong to.

    Author:
    C.Ruff

    the geometry info the geometry array with normals

    generateTriangleNormals

    public GeometryInfo generateTriangleNormals(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                            GeometryInfo geometryInfo,
                                            float creaseAngle)
    Generates normals for the provided geometry info according to the crease angle.
    A crease angle of 180 will result in a all smoothed model, smoothing each vertex normal across all its neighbor faces' face normals.
    A crease angle of zero (0) will result in a flat shaded geometry. Only face normals will be used then.
    A crease angle of 89 will create hard edges at 90 degree angle faces and smooth faces with less then 90 degree normals. This would be ideal to generate normals for a cube.
    The best crease angle for a model has to be found by testing different angles.
    Note:The geometry has to represent a TRIANGLES array!
    Note:The stroke color information gets lost during the process and is reset to the default color. Set it again if needed with setStrokeColorAll.

    Parameters:
    pa - the pa
    geometryInfo - the geometry info
    creaseAngle - the crease angle
    Returns:
    the geometry info the geometry array with normals

    generateSmoothNormals

    public GeometryInfo generateSmoothNormals(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                          Vertex[] originalVertices,
                                          int[] originalIndices,
                                          float[][] originalTexCoords,
                                          int[] originalTexIndices,
                                          float creaseAngle,
                                          boolean flipTextureY,
                                          boolean flipTextureX)
    Generates triangle normals, smoothed acroos all neighbor faces.
    Also dissolves multiple texturecoordinates belonging to the same vertex by duplicating them.

    Parameters:
    pa - the pa
    originalVertices - the original vertices
    originalIndices - the original indices
    originalTexCoords - the original tex coords
    originalTexIndices - the original tex indices
    creaseAngle - the crease angle
    flipTextureY - the flip texture y
    flipTextureX - the flip texture x
    Returns:
    the geometry info

    generateCreaseAngleNormals

    public GeometryInfo generateCreaseAngleNormals(processing.core.PApplet pa,
                                               Vertex[] originalVertices,
                                               int[] originalIndices,
                                               float[][] originalTexCoords,
                                               int[] originalTexIndices,
                                               float creaseAngle,
                                               boolean flipTextureY,
                                               boolean flipTextureX)
    Generates normals for the provided geometry data according to the crease angle.
    A crease angle of 180 will result in a all smoothed model, smoothing each vertex normal across all its neighbor faces' face normals.
    A crease angle of zero (0) will result in a flat shaded geometry. Only face normals will be used then.
    A crease angle of 89 will create hard edges at 90 degree angle faces and smooth faces with less then 90 degree normals. This would be ideal to generate normals for a cube.
    The best crease angle for a model has to be found by testing.

    Parameters:
    pa - the pa
    originalVertices - the original vertices
    originalIndices - the original indices
    originalTexCoords - the original tex coords
    originalTexIndices - the original tex indices
    creaseAngle - the crease angle
    flipTextureY - the flip texture y
    flipTextureX - the flip texture x
    Returns:
    the geometry info indexed, geometry info with normals

    setDebug

    Parameters:

    setUseNormalsEqualToFace

    public void setUseNormalsEqualToFace(boolean useNormalsEqualToFace)
    This influences the normal generation with crease angles. If useNormalsEqualToFace is set to true, normals of neighbor faces, that have the same normal as the face and vertex were checking against will be used in the calculation.
    If useNormalsEqualToFace is set to false, these normals equal to the test face normal will be discarded to avoid adding up redundant normals.
    The default is FALSE.

    Parameters:
    useNormalsEqualToFace - use other normals equal to face or

    setUseEqualNeighborNormalsAgain

    public void setUseEqualNeighborNormalsAgain(boolean useEqualNeighborNormalsAgain)
    This influences the normal generation with crease angles. If useEqualNeighborNormalsAgain is set to true, normals of neighbor faces, that have the same normal as a neighbor face previously used in the calculation for one same vertex normal will again be used and added in.
    If useEqualNeighborNormalsAgain is set to false, these normals will not be added in the calculation again.
    The default is FALSE.

    Parameters:
    useEqualNeighborNormalsAgain - use equal neighbor normals again
